TopicTitle: Kerbin Kolonization Konglomerate - Space Station/Base building Collab

Articles.Content:
This is 307k. You sure?

The probe is at 100k

This is really neat... Everywhere I look this games gets better and better....

Hi there.

I don't know if you already know from the first page or not, but unfortunately, we are full at this moment. I'll be sure to write your name down and give you priority invite if a slot opens up and you want it.

Cheers,

-Sierra

This is 307k. You sure?

The probe is at 100k

http://i.imgur.com/Bhq1Fah.png

307k? Wait, what? What are you trying to say?
lol sorry I think 300k is high so I'm checking with all yous
The save is having problems with the kethane icon in map view. The kethane tab is inaccessible.

lol sorry I think 300k is high so I'm checking with all yous

The station is meant (at least I assume) to recieve shipments of resources from the Munar surface, so you don't want to make it *too* hard on the shuttles to haul that. I personally put kethane stations between 75 and 125km, as that's convenient enough for recieving from ground and from outside the SoI.

The save is having problems with the kethane icon in map view. The kethane tab is inaccessible.

There's a way to move the button via editing kethane's settings.cfg. try changing the position values to 200 and 200.

Yeah the kethane tab looks like this:

I'm not doing anything with the core yet though, We need everyone to sign up before the launch is done.

* Ok Sierra

The station is meant (at least I assume) to recieve shipments of resources from the Munar surface, so you don't want to make it *too* hard on the shuttles to haul that. I personally put kethane stations between 75 and 125km, as that's convenient enough for recieving from ground and from outside the SoI.

Hmm, well I set it as 30k because I meant it more as a mid point for shipping fuel to other places rather than to receive stuff. But if you guys think it should be higher, I think ~50-75k would work.
Looks good! I can take up Fuel Tank 1.

Looks good! I can take up Fuel Tank 1.

Cool! Anyone up for launching fuel tank 2? Also, I think the station altitude will be changed to 50k to better accomodate Kerbin->Mun traffic. Let me know your opinion on the matter too, so I make a good decision.
I think 50 km is a good middle altitude. Quite easy to reach from the surface, not too hard to get to or exit from.

Cool! Anyone up for launching fuel tank 2? Also, I think the station altitude will be changed to 50k to better accomodate Kerbin->Mun traffic. Let me know your opinion on the matter too, so I make a good decision.

I'll take fuel tank 2.

I'll take fuel tank 2.

Sweet.

That means the launch order is as follows:

  • Station Core: Avera9eJoe
  • Docking Arm 1: baberbot
  • Docking Arm 2: Deathsoul097
  • Fuel Tank 1: Monopropellant
  • Fuel Tank 2: Sirine

Now that all modules are assigned, I think we are good to start!

Avera9eJoe, you now have 24 hours to launch the station core to a 50k Munar orbit. If you can't complete the launch, say so, or it'll just automatically go to baberbot and you'll be slotted to the back as everyone is scooched forward.

Happy launching!

Sweet.

  • Docking Arm 1: baberbot

Now that all modules are assigned, I think we are good to start!

Avera9eJoe, you now have 24 hours to launch the station core to a 50k Munar orbit. If you can't complete the launch, say so, or it'll just automatically go to baberbot and you'll be slotted to the back as everyone is scooched forward.

Happy launching!

24 hours, As per your post Ã£â‚¬Âtimes stampÃ£â‚¬â€˜.

Good luck Avera9eJoe !

Hm. I'm just about to leave on a mini-trip, won't be back (and with internet) until late on Saturday.

Can someone take over messaging people that it's their turn and updating the google doc? It should be fairly simple. If Avera9eJoe can't launch the core, make sure the person who does it instead launches it to 50k, and that the schedule is followed from there.

Or, if you guys feel like it should be put on hold after the core is launched until I get back, you can do that, whatever works.

See you later, and happy launching.

baberbot....yours turn.

be ready later today

got a little hw

I found a solution for the kethane problem for Avera9e. GO into the settings and change a line.


ShowOverlay = False
to
ShowOverlay = True

That 'should' fix it, at least it did for me.
should i lower the core's orbit
should i lower the cores orbit?

sry hw too much cant play at all this weekend 3 pices of corsework

Edited February 15, 2014 by baberbot
I got a message that this is open for adding modules to a space station. Is that still open? I am signed up to the (rotating?) list by the way.

I got a message that this is open for adding modules to a space station. Is that still open? I am signed up to the (rotating?) list by the way.

You're on the roster, but it looks like all the modules for the latest station are taken, so no available launches. If you have something you want to add to something existing, or do a single launch mission for something, you can grab the save file after the station is complete. This is a small one so I expect it to be quick.
